Data sorting functions

string[] sortTriggerSet (string[] triggers[, exclude_previous[, func say]])

Sort a group of triggers in an optimal sorting order. The say parameter is a reference to RiveScript.say() or provide your own function (or not) for debug logging from within this function.

This function has two use cases:

  1. create a sort buffer for "normal" (matchable) triggers, which are triggers which are NOT accompanied by a %Previous tag.
  2. create a sort buffer for triggers that had %Previous tags.

Use the exclude_previous parameter to control which one is being done. This function will return a list of items in the format of [ "trigger text", trigger pointer ] and it's intended to have no duplicate trigger patterns (unless the source RiveScript code explicitly uses the same duplicate pattern twice, which is a user error).

string[] sortList (string[] items)

Sort a list of strings by their word counts and lengths.

private object initSortTrack ()

Returns a new object for keeping track of triggers for sorting.
